name: Wolf Fang
description:
Purchase this PS one® Classic and play it on both your PS3™, PS Vita and PSP® (PlayStation®Portable) systems!

Wolf Fang is a high-speed platforming title with heart-pumping run and gun action. An arcade game developed by the legendary Data East, Wolf Fang pits you in control of a mech warrior strike force in a futuristic military struggle in Australia and New Zealand. The horizontal shooter is captured on fast moving scrolling backgrounds allowing players to move and aim their mech’s numerous weapons and guns, which include auto-cannons, a grenade gun, laser gun and even foot soldiers to that can also mount your mech. Each mech can also jump, encouraging strategy towards moving from platform to platform to avoid intense enemy fire.

Wolf Fang also allows players to choose their own paths in the story mode, each with different settings and hordes of high-powered enemies. Destroy all enemies in your path towards liberating Oceania once again!

Download this PS one® Classic today!

Transferring to a PSP® system from your PS3™ system:

You must be signed into the PSN account that originally purchased the game. You must have at least 215 MB free on your Memory Stick Duo™. Connect your PSP® system to your PS3™ system with a USB cable and switch your PSP® system to USB Mode. Highlight the game on the PS3™ XMB™, press the Δ button and select Copy.

PC Store Customers:
Log into your PSN account that you originally used to purchased the game. Then, download the game from your "Download List" in the PlayStation®Store onto your PS3™ system.

This title has been converted from the original PlayStation® disc to the PSP® and the PS3™ systems. Consequently, there may be times where the title plays differently from the PlayStation® disc version, or where some features may not function properly. This version does not support PlayStation® peripherals (controller, memory card, multitap, etc.), therefore functionalities such as multiplayer, versus, and co-op modes are not available.

Please Note: This game is a direct import from Japan and is displayed in its original Japanese language.
